# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `h_joint_disorders`
* Variable label: `History of arthritis, rheumatism or osteoarthritis`
* Variable description: `history of arthritis, rheumatism or osteoarthritis`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | NOT joint_disorders 
1        | joint_disorders

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `h_joint_disorders_age`
* Variable label: `Age first diagnosed joint disorder`
* Variable description: `The age first told had joint disorder diagnosis`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

## HRS

### Wave 1

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `R1ARTHRE` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `R1ARTHRE:W1 R ever had arthritis`|
| **Table name**  | `HRS-HRS-w1`|
| **Categories** | `0 = no`<br/>`1 = yes` |
| **Missings** | `NA` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign hrs_w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HRS_hrs_w1','HRS.HRS-HRS-w1',variables=list('R1ARTHRE'), missings = T)
HRS_hrs_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'HRS_hrs_w1')

```

```{r local hrs_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- HRS_hrs_w1$R1ARTHRE
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HRS_hrs_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HRS_hrs_w1, aes(x=factor(R1ARTHRE))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `NA into 999`

Age of diagnosis cannot be harmonized.

**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w1 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w1$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w1$h_joint_disorders <- car::recode(HRS_hrs_w1$R1ARTHRE, "NA=999")

# We build a global table in order to have updated the status of all the individuals through the different waves
HRS_ds_hrs <- HRS_ds_hrs_w1
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_ds_hrs$id))

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R1ARTHRE == 0 and R2ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R1ARTHRE == 1 or R2ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2+(year of interview w1 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w2}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_hrs_w2 <- left_join(HRS_hrs_w2, HRS_ds_hrs, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w2 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w2$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w2$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w2$R2ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w2$R2ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w2$R2ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w2$R2ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_hrs_w2$R2ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w2$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_hrs_w2$yintw_hrs_w2[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_hrs_w2$yintw_hrs_w1[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w2$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_hrs[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_hrs_w2,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_hrs_w2$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_hrs$id %in% HRS_ds_hrs_w2$id) & (HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w2$h_joint_disorders != 999)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R1ARTHRE == 0 and R2ARTHRE == 0 and R3ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R1ARTHRE == 1 or R2ARTHRE == 1 or R3ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w3 and 0 in w2, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w3-year of interview w2)/2+(year of interview w2 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w3 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w3}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_hrs_w3 <- left_join(HRS_hrs_w3, HRS_ds_hrs, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w3 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w3$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w3$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w3$R3ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w3$R3ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w3$R3ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w3$R3ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_hrs_w3$R3ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w3$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w3$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_hrs_w3$yintw_hrs_w3[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w3$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_hrs_w3$yintw_hrs_w2[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w3$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_hrs_w3$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w3$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_hrs[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_hrs_w3,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_hrs_w3$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_hrs$id %in% HRS_ds_hrs_w3$id) & (HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w3$h_joint_disorders != 999)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R1ARTHRE == 0 and R2ARTHRE == 0 and R3ARTHRE == 0 and R4ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R1ARTHRE == 1 or R2ARTHRE == 1 or R3ARTHRE == 1 or R4ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w4 and 0 in w3, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w4-year of interview w3)/2+(year of interview w3 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w4 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w4}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_hrs_w4 <- left_join(HRS_hrs_w4, HRS_ds_hrs, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w4 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w4$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w4$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w4$R4ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w4$R4ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w4$R4ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w4$R4ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_hrs_w4$R4ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w4$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w4$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_hrs_w4$yintw_hrs_w4[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w4$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_hrs_w4$yintw_hrs_w3[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w4$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_hrs_w4$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w4$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_hrs[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_hrs_w4,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_hrs_w4$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_hrs$id %in% HRS_ds_hrs_w4$id) & (HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w4$h_joint_disorders != 999)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R1ARTHRE == 0 and R2ARTHRE == 0 and R3ARTHRE == 0 and R4ARTHRE == 0 and R5ARTHRE == 0 and R6ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R1ARTHRE == 1 or R2ARTHRE == 1 or R3ARTHRE == 1 or R4ARTHRE == 1 or R5ARTHRE == 1 or R6ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w6 and 0 in w5, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w6-year of interview w5)/2+(year of interview w5 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w6 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w6}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_hrs_w6 <- left_join(HRS_hrs_w6, HRS_ds_hrs, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w6 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w6$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w6$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w6$R6ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w6$R6ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_hrs_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w6$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_hrs_w6$yintw_hrs_w6[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_hrs_w6$yintw_hrs_w5[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_hrs_w6$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_hrs[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_hrs_w6,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_hrs_w6$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_hrs$id %in% HRS_ds_hrs_w6$id) & (HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w6$h_joint_disorders != 999)]

```

```{r harmo hrs_w10}
# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_hrs[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_hrs_w10,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_hrs_w10$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_hrs$id %in% HRS_ds_hrs_w10$id) & (HRS_ds_hrs$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_hrs_w10$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w10$h_joint_disorders != 999)]
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R1ARTHRE == 0 and R2ARTHRE == 0 and R3ARTHRE == 0 and R4ARTHRE == 0 and R5ARTHRE == 0 and R6ARTHRE == 0 and R7ARTHRE == 0 and R8ARTHRE == 0 and R9ARTHRE == 0 and R10ARTHRE == 0 and R11ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R1ARTHRE == 1 or R2ARTHRE == 1 or R3ARTHRE == 1 or R4ARTHRE == 1 or R5ARTHRE == 1 or R6ARTHRE == 1 or R7ARTHRE == 1 or R8ARTHRE == 1 or R9ARTHRE == 1 or R10ARTHRE == 1 or R11ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w11 and 0 in w10, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w11-year of interview w10)/2+(year of interview w10 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w11 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo hrs_w11}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_hrs_w11 <- left_join(HRS_hrs_w11, HRS_ds_hrs, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w11 <- tibble(id=HRS_hrs_w11$id)
HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w11$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w11$R11ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w11$R11ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w11$R11ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w11$R11ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_hrs_w11$R11ARTHRE)) & HRS_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_hrs_w11$id))
HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_hrs_w11$yintw_hrs_w11[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_hrs_w11$yintw_hrs_w10[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_hrs_w11$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_hrs_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_hrs_w11$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
rm(HRS_ds_hrs)
```

```{r harmo ahead_w3}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R2ARTHRE == 0 and R3ARTHRE == 0 and R4ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R2ARTHRE == 1 or R3ARTHRE == 1 or R4ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w4 and 0 in w3, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w4-year of interview w3)/2+(year of interview w3 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w4 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo ahead_w4}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_ahead_w4 <- left_join(HRS_ahead_w4, HRS_ds_ahead, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ahead_w4 <- tibble(id=HRS_ahead_w4$id)
HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_ahead_w4$id))
HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_ahead_w4$R4ARTHRE)) & HRS_ahead_w4$R4ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_ahead_w4$R4ARTHRE)) & HRS_ahead_w4$R4ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_ahead_w4$R4ARTHRE)) & HRS_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_ahead_w4$id))
HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w4$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_ahead_w4$yintw_ahead_w4[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w4$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_ahead_w4$yintw_ahead_w3[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w4$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_ahead_w4$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w4$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_ahead[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_ahead_w4,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_ahead_w4$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_ahead$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_ahead$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_ahead$id %in% HRS_ds_ahead_w4$id) & (HRS_ds_ahead$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w4$h_joint_disorders != 999)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R2ARTHRE == 0 and R3ARTHRE == 0 and R4ARTHRE == 0 and R5ARTHRE == 0 and R6ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R2ARTHRE == 1 or R3ARTHRE == 1 or R4ARTHRE == 1 or R5ARTHRE == 1 or R6ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w6 and 0 in w5, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w6-year of interview w5)/2+(year of interview w5 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w6 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo ahead_w6}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_ahead_w6 <- left_join(HRS_ahead_w6, HRS_ds_ahead, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ahead_w6 <- tibble(id=HRS_ahead_w6$id)
HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_ahead_w6$id))
HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_ahead_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_ahead_w6$R6ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_ahead_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_ahead_w6$R6ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_ahead_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_ahead_w6$id))
HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_ahead_w6$yintw_ahead_w6[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_ahead_w6$yintw_ahead_w5[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_ahead_w6$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_ahead[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_ahead_w6,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_ahead_w6$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_ahead$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_ahead$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_ahead$id %in% HRS_ds_ahead_w6$id) & (HRS_ds_ahead$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w6$h_joint_disorders != 999)]

```

```{r harmo ahead_w10}
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_ahead[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_ahead_w10,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_ahead_w10$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_ahead$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_ahead$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_ahead$id %in% HRS_ds_ahead_w10$id) & (HRS_ds_ahead$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_ahead_w10$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w10$h_joint_disorders != 999)]
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R2ARTHRE == 0 and R3ARTHRE == 0 and R4ARTHRE == 0 and R5ARTHRE == 0 and R6ARTHRE == 0 and R7ARTHRE == 0 and R8ARTHRE == 0 and R9ARTHRE == 0 and R10ARTHRE == 0 and R11ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R2ARTHRE == 1 or R3ARTHRE == 1 or R4ARTHRE == 1 or R5ARTHRE == 1 or R6ARTHRE == 1 or R7ARTHRE == 1 or R8ARTHRE == 1 or R9ARTHRE == 1 or R10ARTHRE == 1 or R11ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w11 and 0 in w10, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w11-year of interview w10)/2+(year of interview w10 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w11 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo ahead_w11}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_ahead_w11 <- left_join(HRS_ahead_w11, HRS_ds_ahead, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ahead_w11 <- tibble(id=HRS_ahead_w11$id)
HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_ahead_w11$id))
HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_ahead_w11$R11ARTHRE)) & HRS_ahead_w11$R11ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_ahead_w11$R11ARTHRE)) & HRS_ahead_w11$R11ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_ahead_w11$R11ARTHRE)) & HRS_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_ahead_w11$id))
HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_ahead_w11$yintw_ahead_w11[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_ahead_w11$yintw_ahead_w10[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_ahead_w11$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ahead_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_ahead_w11$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
rm(HRS_ds_ahead)

```

* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo coda_w5}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_coda_w5 <- left_join(HRS_coda_w5, HRS_ds_coda, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_coda_w5 <- tibble(id=HRS_coda_w5$id)

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_coda_w5$id))
HRS_ds_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w5$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_coda_w5$yintw_coda_w5[which(HRS_ds_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w5$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_coda_w5$yintw_coda_w4[which(HRS_ds_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w5$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_coda_w5$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w5$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}

HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_coda$id %in% HRS_ds_coda_w5$id) & (HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w5$h_joint_disorders != 999)]
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R4ARTHRE == 0 and R5ARTHRE == 0 and R6ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R4ARTHRE == 1 or R5ARTHRE == 1 or R6ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w6 and 0 in w5, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w6-year of interview w5)/2+(year of interview w5 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w6 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo coda_w6}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_coda_w6 <- left_join(HRS_coda_w6, HRS_ds_coda, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_coda_w6 <- tibble(id=HRS_coda_w6$id)
HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_coda_w6$id))
HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_coda_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_coda_w6$R6ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_coda_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_coda_w6$R6ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_coda_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_coda_w6$id))
HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_coda_w6$yintw_coda_w6[which(HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_coda_w6$yintw_coda_w5[which(HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_coda_w6$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_coda[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_coda_w6,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_coda_w6$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_coda$id %in% HRS_ds_coda_w6$id) & (HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w6$h_joint_disorders != 999)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R4ARTHRE == 0 and R5ARTHRE == 0 and R6ARTHRE == 0 and R7ARTHRE == 0 and R8ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R4ARTHRE == 1 or R5ARTHRE == 1 or R6ARTHRE == 1 or R7ARTHRE == 1 or R8ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w8 and 0 in w7, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w8-year of interview w7)/2+(year of interview w7 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w8 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo coda_w8}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_coda_w8 <- left_join(HRS_coda_w8, HRS_ds_coda, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_coda_w8 <- tibble(id=HRS_coda_w8$id)
HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_coda_w8$id))
HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_coda_w8$R8ARTHRE)) & HRS_coda_w8$R8ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_coda_w8$R8ARTHRE)) & HRS_coda_w8$R8ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_coda_w8$R8ARTHRE)) & HRS_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_coda_w8$id))
HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w8$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_coda_w8$yintw_coda_w8[which(HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w8$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_coda_w8$yintw_coda_w7[which(HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w8$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_coda_w8$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w8$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_coda[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_coda_w8,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_coda_w8$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_coda$id %in% HRS_ds_coda_w8$id) & (HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w8$h_joint_disorders != 999)]

```

```{r harmo coda_w10}
# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_coda[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_coda_w10,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_coda_w10$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_coda$id %in% HRS_ds_coda_w10$id) & (HRS_ds_coda$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_coda_w10$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w10$h_joint_disorders != 999)]
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R4ARTHRE == 0 and R5ARTHRE == 0 and R6ARTHRE == 0 and R7ARTHRE == 0 and R8ARTHRE == 0 and R9ARTHRE == 0 and R10ARTHRE == 0 and R11ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R4ARTHRE == 1 or R5ARTHRE == 1 or R6ARTHRE == 1 or R7ARTHRE == 1 or R8ARTHRE == 1 or R9ARTHRE == 1 or R10ARTHRE == 1 or R11ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w11 and 0 in w10, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w11-year of interview w10)/2+(year of interview w10 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w11 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo coda_w11}

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_coda_w11$id))
HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_coda_w11$yintw_coda_w11[which(HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_coda_w11$yintw_coda_w10[which(HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_coda_w11$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_coda_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_coda_w11$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
rm(HRS_ds_coda)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R4ARTHRE == 0 and R5ARTHRE == 0 and R6ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R4ARTHRE == 1 or R5ARTHRE == 1 or R6ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w6 and 0 in w5, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w6-year of interview w5)/2+(year of interview w5 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w6 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo wb_w6}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_wb_w6 <- left_join(HRS_wb_w6, HRS_ds_wb, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_wb_w6 <- tibble(id=HRS_wb_w6$id)
HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_wb_w6$id))
HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_wb_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_wb_w6$R6ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_wb_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_wb_w6$R6ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_wb_w6$R6ARTHRE)) & HRS_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_wb_w6$id))
HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_wb_w6$yintw_wb_w6[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_wb_w6$yintw_wb_w5[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_wb_w6$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w6$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")

  newtib
}

HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_wb_w6,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_wb_w6$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)

HRS_ds_wb$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_wb$id %in% HRS_ds_wb_w6$id) & (HRS_ds_wb$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w6$h_joint_disorders != 999)]
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R4ARTHRE == 0 and R5ARTHRE == 0 and R6ARTHRE == 0 and R7ARTHRE == 0 and R8ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R4ARTHRE == 1 or R5ARTHRE == 1 or R6ARTHRE == 1 or R7ARTHRE == 1 or R8ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w8 and 0 in w7, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w8-year of interview w7)/2+(year of interview w7 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w8 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo wb_w8}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_wb_w8 <- left_join(HRS_wb_w8, HRS_ds_wb, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_wb_w8 <- tibble(id=HRS_wb_w8$id)
HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_wb_w8$id))
HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_wb_w8$R8ARTHRE)) & HRS_wb_w8$R8ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_wb_w8$R8ARTHRE)) & HRS_wb_w8$R8ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_wb_w8$R8ARTHRE)) & HRS_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_wb_w8$id))
HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w8$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_wb_w8$yintw_wb_w8[which(HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w8$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_wb_w8$yintw_wb_w7[which(HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w8$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_wb_w8$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w8$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_wb[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_wb_w8,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_wb_w8$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_wb$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_wb$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_wb$id %in% HRS_ds_wb_w8$id) & (HRS_ds_wb$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w8$h_joint_disorders != 999)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R4ARTHRE == 0 and R5ARTHRE == 0 and R6ARTHRE == 0 and R7ARTHRE == 0 and R8ARTHRE == 0 and R9ARTHRE == 0 and R10ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R4ARTHRE == 1 or R5ARTHRE == 1 or R6ARTHRE == 1 or R7ARTHRE == 1 or R8ARTHRE == 1 or R9ARTHRE == 1 or R10ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w10 and 0 in w9, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w10-year of interview w9)/2+(year of interview w9 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w10 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo wb_w10}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_wb_w10 <- left_join(HRS_wb_w10, HRS_ds_wb, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_wb_w10 <- tibble(id=HRS_wb_w10$id)
HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_wb_w10$id))
HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_wb_w10$R10ARTHRE)) & HRS_wb_w10$R10ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_wb_w10$R10ARTHRE)) & HRS_wb_w10$R10ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_wb_w10$R10ARTHRE)) & HRS_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_wb_w10$id))
HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_wb_w10$yintw_wb_w10[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_wb_w10$yintw_wb_w9[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_wb_w10$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_wb_w10$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
assign_merge <- function(endtib,sttib,log_vec=c(T),col_end_index=NULL,col_st_index=NULL){
  newtib <- left_join(endtib,sttib,by="id")
  newtib[log_vec,col_end_index] <- newtib[log_vec,col_st_index]
  id_ind <- match("id",names(newtib))
  newtib <- newtib[,c(id_ind,col_end_index)]
  names(newtib)[2] <- "x"
  newtib$x <- car::recode(newtib$x,"NA=999")
  names(newtib)[2] <- names(endtib)[col_end_index]
  newtib
}
HRS_ds_prov <- HRS_ds_wb[,c(1,2)]
HRS_ds_prov <- assign_merge(HRS_ds_prov,HRS_ds_wb_w10,log_vec=(HRS_ds_prov$id %in% HRS_ds_wb_w10$id),col_end_index = 2, col_st_index = 3)
HRS_ds_wb$h_joint_disorders <- HRS_ds_prov$h_joint_disorders
rm(HRS_ds_prov)
HRS_ds_wb$h_joint_disorders_age[which((HRS_ds_wb$id %in% HRS_ds_wb_w10$id) & (HRS_ds_wb$h_joint_disorders != 999))] <- HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_wb_w10$h_joint_disorders != 999)]

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R7ARTHRE == 0 and R8ARTHRE == 0 and R9ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R7ARTHRE == 1 or R8ARTHRE == 1 or R9ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w9 and 0 in w8, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w9-year of interview w8)/2+(year of interview w8 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w9 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_joint_disorders` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `R7ARTHRE == 0 and R8ARTHRE == 0 and R9ARTHRE == 0 and R10ARTHRE == 0 and R11ARTHRE == 0 into 0`
* `R7ARTHRE == 1 or R8ARTHRE == 1 or R9ARTHRE == 1 or R10ARTHRE == 1 or R11ARTHRE == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_joint_disorders_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w11 and 0 in w10, h_joint_disorders_age = (year of interview w11-year of interview w10)/2+(year of interview w10 -ybirth)`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 1 in w11 and other wave, h_joint_disorders_age as previously`
* `if h_joint_disorders == 0, h_joint_disorders_age = 996`
* `h_joint_disorders == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo ebb_w11}

# We use the harmonized variable of previous waves instead of the study-specific variables
HRS_ebb_w11 <- left_join(HRS_ebb_w11, HRS_ds_ebb, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ebb_w11 <- tibble(id=HRS_ebb_w11$id)
HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders <- rep(999,length(HRS_ebb_w11$id))
HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_ebb_w11$R11ARTHRE)) & HRS_ebb_w11$R11ARTHRE == 0) & (HRS_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders != 1))] <- 0
HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders[which(((!is.na(HRS_ebb_w11$R11ARTHRE)) & HRS_ebb_w11$R11ARTHRE == 1) | ((!is.na(HRS_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders)) & (!is.na(HRS_ebb_w11$R11ARTHRE)) & HRS_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders_age <- rep(999,length(HRS_ebb_w11$id))
HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders == 0)] <- 996
HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ebb_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)] <- (HRS_ebb_w11$yintw_ebb_w11[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ebb_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]+HRS_ebb_w11$yintw_ebb_w10[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ebb_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)])/2-HRS_ebb_w11$ybirth[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & HRS_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders==0 & !HRS_ebb_w11$ybirth %in% miss_values_vector)]
HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)] <- HRS_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders_age[which(HRS_ds_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders == 1 & !HRS_ebb_w11$h_joint_disorders_age %in% miss_values_vector)]

# We update the status of the individuals in the global table
rm(HRS_ds_ebb)

```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories. To avoid too large table, Only trajectories with percentages larger than 0.3 are shown.

**R script:**
